column4: What is Martinp23 talking about?  How do you identify to the NickServ?
if your nick is not registered with nickserv, ignore that
you'll probably have to remove them manually
Maybe I could write a script?
he already said what his problem was as Guest89323
no, just identify to nickserv
Will I have to "/identify" ??
/msg nickserv identify <password>
Everytime?
yes
you can probably set your client to do that for you automatically
What is the point of this?
it's the same as registering anywhere else
if your client has a server password option, use your nickserv password as the server password for freenode.  That will identify you automatically
I am new ot irc chats but I can't think of any other channels that I have to identify to join

you also need a registered nick in order to register channels, be added to chanserv's access lists with special permissiions, or make it so that nobody else can use your nick.  See /msg nickserv help set enforce    for how to keep others from using your nick
Giddorah: I think it's called konsole
openoffice, I think
Really?
puppy linux does for sure.  I don't know if ubuntu has that capability yet though
constantine, it's not sentient yet...
constantine , I think that's planned for 10.10
